problems.problem_description:
# Problem setup:
Consider a quantum field theory with holographic dual. Under a Weyl transformation, the boundary metric transforms as $\gamma_{\mu
u}^{(0)}	o{\cal B}^{-2}(x)\gamma_{\mu
u}^{(0)}$. The Weyl anomaly ${\cal A}_k$ of the theory in $2k$ dimensions appears in the transformation of the partition function:
 egin{align}
Z[\gamma_{\mu
u}^{(0)}]	o e^{-{\cal A}_k}Z[{\cal B}(x)^{-2}\gamma^{(0)}].
\end{align}
This can be computed by evaluating the on-shell action of the bulk gravitational theory.

The holographic Weyl anomaly in $d\leqslant8$ can be express using the following quantities:
 egin{align}
P_{\mu
u}={}&R^{(0)}_{\mu
u}- rac{R^{(0)}}{2(d-1)}\gamma_{\mu
u}^{(0)}\,,\
B_{\mu
u}={}& rac{1}{d-2} ig(
abla^{(0)}_ho
abla_{(0)}^ho  P_{\mu
u}-
abla^{(0)}_ho
abla^{(0)}_{
u} P_{\mu}{}^{ho}- W^{(0)}_{ho
u\mu\sigma} P^{\sigmaho} ig)\,,\
O_{\mu
u}={}&
abla_{(0)}^\lambda
abla^{(0)}_\lambda B_{\mu
u}-2W^{(0)}_{ho
u\mu\lambda}B^{\lambdaho}- rac{4}{d-2}B_{\mu
u}P^\mu{}_\mu+ rac{2(d-4)}{(d-2)^2} ig(2P^{ho\lambda}
abla^{(0)}_\lambda C_{(\mu
u)ho}\
&+
abla^{(0)}_\lambda PC_{(\mu
u)}{}^\lambda-C^{ho}{}_{\mu}{}^{\lambda}C_{\lambda
uho}+ 
abla_{(0)}^\lambda P^ho{}_{(\mu}C_{
u)ho\lambda}-W^{(0)}_{ho\mu
u\lambda}P^{\lambda}{}_\sigma P^{\sigmaho} ig)\,,\
\Omega_{\mu
u}={}&
abla_{(0)}^\lambda
abla^{(0)}_\lambda B_{\mu
u}-2W^{(0)}_{ho
u\mu\lambda}B^{\lambdaho}-4B_{\mu
u}P^\mu{}_\mu+2(d-4) ig(2P^{ho\lambda}
abla^{(0)}_\lambda C_{(\mu
u)ho}\
&+
abla^{(0)}_\lambda PC_{(\mu
u)}{}^\lambda-C^{ho}{}_{\mu}{}^{\lambda}C_{\lambda
uho}+ 
abla_{(0)}^\lambda P^ho{}_{(\mu}C_{
u)ho\lambda}-W^{(0)}_{ho\mu
u\lambda}P^{\lambda}{}_\sigma P^{\sigmaho} ig)+P_{\muho}P^{ho\sigma}P_{\sigma
u},
\end{align}
where $R^{(0)}_{\mu
u}$ is the Ricci tensor for the boundary metric $\gamma_{\mu
u}^{(0)}$, $
abla^{(0)}_\mu$ is the covariant derivative associated with $\gamma^{(0)}_{ij}$ on the boundary, $W^{(0)}_{ho
u\mu\sigma}$ is the Weyl tensor on the boundary, and $C_{\mu
uho}=
abla^{(0)}_ho P_{\mu
u}-
abla^{(0)}_
u P_{\muho}$.

The final expression will have the form
 egin{align}
{\cal A}_4=&- rac{L^7}{8\pi G}\int d^8x\sqrt{-\det\gamma^{(0)}}X^{(4)}\ln {\cal B},
\end{align}
where $X^{(4)}$ may contain the following terms: $	ext{tr}(P^4)$, $	ext{tr}(P^3)$, $	ext{tr}(P^3)	ext{tr}(P)$, $	ext{tr}(BP)$, $	ext{tr}(BP^2)$, $	ext{tr}(B^2)$, $	ext{tr}(B^2P)$, $	ext{tr}(OP)$, $	ext{tr}(OP^2)$, $	ext{tr}(\Omega)$, $	ext{tr}(\Omega P)$.

# Main problem:
Determine the coefficients of these terms in $X^{(4)}$.
problems.code_template:
def answer():
    r"""
    Return coefficients of the terms.

    Input
    ----------
    None

    Output
    ----------
    coeffs: list[float], the coefficients of terms in $X^{(4)}$, in the order given in the problem
    """
    # ------------------ FILL IN YOUR RESULTS BELOW ------------------
    coeffs = ...
    # ---------------------------------------------------------------

    return coeffs
